ARABIC: يَٰوَيْلَتَىٰ لَيْتَنِى لَمْ أَتَّخِذْ فُلَانًا خَلِيلًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Alas for me! If only I had not taken so-and-so for a friend!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Woe alas, ah would I had not taken so-and-so as friend!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: O, woe to me! Would that I had not chosen so and so for a friend!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Woe to us! Would that we had not been friends with so and so.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Woe to me – alas, if only I had not taken that one for a friend.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Ah! Woe to me! Would that I had never taken so-and-so as an intimate friend!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: O woe is me! would that I had not taken such a one for a friend!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Alas, would that I had not taken So-and-so for a friend!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Alas for me! Ah, would that I had never taken such an one for friend!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Oh, would that I had never chosen such a one for my companion --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Ah! woe unto me! wouldthat had never taken such a one for a friend!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Woe to me! I wish I had not taken so and so as a friend!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Ah! woe is me! Would that I had never taken such a one for a friend!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Ah! Woe to me! Would that I had never taken so-and-so as a friend!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Would that I had never chosen soandso for my companion!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Oh, woe to me; I wish I never took so-and-so for a friend.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Oh, woe to me! I wish I had not taken that one as a friend.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [25:28] O woe to me! (yā waylatā: the [final] alif stands in place of the [first person singular] possessive yā’, yā waylatī, meaning ‘[alas] for my destruction!’) Would that I had not taken so and so, in other words, [that] Ubayy, as friend!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Alas for me! Ah, would that I had never taken such an one) Ubayy Ibn Khalaf (for friend) following his religion!
